newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australian wool prices expected to firm.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australian wool prices expected to firm.

text.p: Australian wool prices are expected to firm at sales this week in Sydney, Melbourne and Fremandle, Wesfarmers Dalgety Ltd said in its weekly market preview.

Wesfarmers this view was based on signs of strengthening for some wools last week when the eastern market indicator rose four cents to 556 cents a kg, clean. About 143,800 bales will be offered, the largest offering of the season to date.
Wesfarmers said last week's stable prices were encouraging as sales this week represent the final opportunity buyers have to complete orders for December and January delivery.
Wesfarmers said stockpile sales were relatively large last week, indicating forward trading over the next few months.
Sharp grower resistance, evidenced last week by escalating clip withdrawals prior to sale, was also expected to prevent significant downside in the market.
However, the exceptionally large rostered quantity for sale would test the strength of these positive factors, restricting upside and keeping prices at current levels, Wesfarmers said.
